event: Earliest human presence in present-day Peru
Early coastal civilizations develop agriculture and urban centers
Norte Chico civilization builds some of the Americas’ oldest cities
Moche culture flourishes along the northern coast
Wari state expands across the central Andes
Tiwanaku influence spreads into southern Peru
Inca civilization emerges in the Cusco region
Inca Empire expands to dominate much of western South America
Spanish forces capture Inca ruler Atahualpa
Lima is founded as the colonial capital
Viceroyalty of Peru is established by Spain
Túpac Amaru II leads major Indigenous rebellion
Spanish rule ends after decisive battles
War of the Pacific weakens Peru and alters borders
Indigenous identity gains recognition in national culture
Military government introduces land and social reforms
Democratic order is restored after political crisis
